Class netscape.application.ColorWell 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----netscape.application.View
           |
           +----netscape.application.DragWell
                   |
                   +----netscape.application.ColorWell
public class ColorWell
extends DragWell
implements DragDestination, Target
DragWell subclass that accepts and vends drag-and-dropped Colors. When the user drops a Color onto a ColorWell, the ColorWell sets its color to that dropped color and sends a command to its Target.

SHOW_COLOR_CHOOSER
Sending this command to a ColorWell will show the color chooser

ColorWell()
Constructs a ColorWell with origin (0, 0) and zero width and height.
ColorWell(int, int, int, int)
Constructs a ColorWell with bounds (x, y, width, height).
ColorWell(Rect)
Constructs a ColorWell with bounds rect.

acceptsDrag(DragSession, int, int)
Returns the ColorWell if the DragSession has a data type of Color.COLOR_TYPE, null otherwise.

Overriden to return true

SHOW_COLOR_CHOOSER 
 public static final String SHOW_COLOR_CHOOSER
Sending this command to a ColorWell will show the color chooser

setColor 
 public void setColor(Color aColor)
Sets the ColorWell's color and then calls draw() to redraw it. If you do not want to immediately redraw the ColorWell, you should first call its disableDrawing() method.

mouseDown 
 public boolean mouseDown(MouseEvent event)
Initiates a drag-session where the user can drag the ColorWell's color, unless the ColorWell is disabled (in which case nothing happens). A double-click in the well invokes the ColorChooser.

Returns:
false if disabled, true otherwise.
Overrides:
mouseDown in class DragWell
See Also:

dragDropped 
 public boolean dragDropped(DragSession session)
Drag-and-drop destination support method, called when the user releases a DragSession's Image over the ColorWell. If the DragSession represents a Color, the ColorWell calls its setColor() method with the dropped Color and sends its command to its Target. If the ColorWell is disabled, or the DragSession doesn't represent a Color, the ColorWell refuses the object. Returns true if the session was accepted, false otherwise.

See Also:
setColor, setEnabled, dragDropped
sendCommand 
 public void sendCommand()
Called by the ColorWell to send its command to its Target.

See Also:
setTarget, setCommand

                            Object data)
